Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert J Bertz was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 5 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Perform Alcohol Assessment. 
Victim Impact Panel meeting has been completed.
Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert J Bertz in court with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed by operation of law.  Count #3 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Atorney Masnica makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:  

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

31 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 5 days)
  -  13 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

*DL REVOCATION:  30 MONTHS
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 30 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 


COSTS:  $3,039.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($2,500.00) remainder due as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
WCS attendance verification slips
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
